definition: to harmonize/to reconcile/to blend/to suit well/to adjust/to regulate/to season (food)/to provoke/to incite
to transfer/to move (troops or cadres)/to investigate/to enquire into/accent/view/argument/key (in music)/mode (music)/tune/tone/melody

sentences.english: I'm still green at this, but I can play a few tunes.
sentences.chinese: 我對這個還有點生，但我能彈幾個曲調。

sentences.english: Wind Cavity melodious tunes pleasant, mild smooth, emotional performance than diversified.
sentences.chinese: 吹腔曲調悠揚動聽，流暢溫和，表現的情感亦較多樣。

sentences.english: This poem goes to  the tune of “This old Man”.
sentences.chinese: 這首詩與《這位老人》的曲調相配。

sentences.english: Later, several tunes were combined into one song, or piece of music.
sentences.chinese: 後來，纔將幾個曲調組合成一支歌或一首樂曲。

sentences.english: Libretto clear melody sounds, become a famous folk singer.
sentences.chinese: 唱詞清楚，曲調動聽，成爲有名的民歌手。

sentences.english: Coleman to court. In court, they proved that they, indeed, owned the melody.
sentences.chinese: 在法庭上，她們證明，上她們擁有這首歌曲調的版權。

sentences.english: The best tune hasn't been played yet;
sentences.chinese: 最美妙的曲調還未湊出。

sentences.english: The tune combines elements of Zhejiang folk music with the Guangdong style.
sentences.chinese: 曲調既採用了浙江的民間音樂，又有廣東音樂的風格。

sentences.english: A real leader faces the music, even when he doesn't like the ture . ------Anon.
sentences.chinese: 真正的領導人正視音樂，即使他不喜歡其曲調。

sentences.english: The tunes he composed gave each member a chance to shine.
sentences.chinese: 他所作的曲調讓樂團中的每位成員都有機會露一手。

sentences.english: You get to pick the tune.
She smiled and left, and the music changed to Billy Joel tune.
sentences.chinese: 她微笑一下然後走開了，旋律變成了比利喬的曲調。

sentences.english: "Seven-word song" is one of the major tunes in Taiwanese Opera.
sentences.chinese: 是歌仔戲唱腔中最主要的曲調。

sentences.english: They borrowed the song "Three Rules of Discipline Eight Points for Attention, " sang out of tune.
sentences.chinese: 他們借用歌曲《三大紀律八項注意》曲調唱了出來。

sentences.english: Let's sing these lines to the tune of Red Vally.
sentences.chinese: 讓我們用紅河谷的曲調唱這些詞。

sentences.english: To tremble or quaver in sound, as of the voice or a musical note.
sentences.chinese: 如嗓音或曲調等聲音抖動或顫抖。

definition: part (in multi-part instrumental or choral music), such as the soprano part or bass part
old style/old custom/a pre-Tang Dynasty genre of poetry aka 古體詩|古体诗[ɡu3 ti3 shi1]
see 頓挫抑揚|顿挫抑扬[dun4 cuo4 yi4 yang2]
